intro: Anserina, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the genus Calendula, which is part of the sunflower family, Asteraceae. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Anserina typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
